intro: Gonolobus biflorus, commonly known as the two-flowered goonloob, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It belongs to the family Leguminosae, also known as the Fabaceae family, which includes many legumes. The plant is characterized by its erect or prostrate growth habit and produces small, yellow flowers that are often clustered in groups of two. Its leaves are typically trifoliate, consisting of three leaflets, and it has a distinctive, hairy stem. Gonolobus biflorus is often found in moist, tropical environments and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
